entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Time Off 2026 leave balance
entry.content: Is it possible in SAP SuccessFactors Time Off to open or generate the 2026 leave balance now instead of waiting until January 1st? We want employees to view their upcoming year balance in advance. Which configuration or accrual generation option should be adjusted?

entry.title: Is there a way to identify if a transaction is initiated by Supervisor/Manager in the business rules
entry.content:
Hi team,

I'm looking for a way to identify if a transaction is initiated by Manager/Supervisor in the business rules? We want to trigger different workflows based on if the initiator is Manager vs. HR.

Thank you.

entry.title: Using Import Export Data for Legal Entity: How to Reject Rows Outside the User‚Äôs auth. Coutry scope
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

In SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, we use the ‚ÄúImport and Export Data‚Äù tool to manage Legal Entity (FOLegalEntity) imports. But we want to grant admin rights to specific users while restricting their import scope for specific countries ‚Äî for example, if a user wants to load Legal Entities:

  • User X: can only load Belgium & France related legal entities
  • User Y: can only load Spain & Italy only related legal entities
  • User Z: can only load USA & Canada only related legal entities

Question: How can we configure Role-Based Permissions (RBP) so that when User X uploads a CSV file containing Legal Entities from multiple countries, the rows related to Spain/Italy/USA/Canada are automatically rejected during import processing (showing ‚ÄúNo permission‚Äù errors in logs)?

Thank you a lot,
D√©borah A.

entry.title: Can you save and submit records later in employee central people profile
entry.content: Is it possible to save and submit records later in the employee central people profile and then trigger notifications on submit like it is in permofance.

entry.title: Employee Replication as Vendors in S/4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
I have a client who uses SuccessFactors and is currently transitioning from ECC to S/4 Public Cloud. Due to client requirements, we are leveraging scope ID JB1 to integrate SuccessFactors and S/4.

Today, my client does not maintain employee payment details in SuccessFactors and only maintains this data in ECC. They also use program RPRAPA00 which creates an SM35 batch job to handle the creation of employees as vendors. Given program RPRAPA00 is no longer available in S/4 Public Cloud, we would be unable to leverage what they do today. Also, since they do not maintain payment information in SuccessFactors, we are unable to leverage the standard functionality available as part of JB1.

With all that in mind, I am looking for assistance in solving two problems:

  1. How can we accomplish the initial replication of employees where they get created as vendors? I thought about plugging standard values for all records in the API but that would create issues with any future payments based on what is populated in the supplier master. 
  2. How can we load the legacy employee vendors from ECC with their bank/payment details and then link it to the BP created through the SuccessFactors integration?

entry.title: How to restrict MDF FO Objects an admin can manage using "Restrict Target Criteria to:"
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community, 

I'm trying to restrict the MDF Foundation Objects an admin can manage using a role in which I define target criteria.

Ex: I want the admin. to only manager Legal Entities from Europe, so I restrict the Legal Entity. country to these 3 countries: France, Germany and Belgium

‚ÄÉ

Here is the configuration of the Legal Entity Object Definition 

As a result, in "Manage Data", the administrator see all legal entities objects without restriction. üòï

Does anyone have any idea what I'm missing?

Thank you, 
D√©borah

entry.title: Is there a EUDP Switch in provisioning in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hi ,

  Our Dev is EUDP enabled and our preview is non EUDP. Can you tell us how to enable or disable EUDP switch in provisioning. We cant find anything in the company settings in Provisioning. Support ticket has been raised, but SAP has informed that it has to be done by partner in provisioning.

Thanks for the help

Arunsri B.S

entry.title: How to extract the termination initiation date of contingent workers in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
For contingent workers, we have not setup any workflows for their terminations. Their termination is captured only through the contract end date, so there is no termination initiation date or similar field to compare against.

Because of this, we are unable to determine whether a contingent worker termination was backdated (in case of termination performed before the recorded contract end date.)

Ex: If a contingent worker is maintained with End of Contingent as Dec 10th, but if there is a early termination and if they terminate him effective Nov 10th, but updated this in the system on Nov 25th, this is a case of backdated termination in Contingent workers. 

In this case we are required to extract the data of action in the system as Nov 25th and as the workflow is not available in this case, we are not able to report on the workflow initiation date as well.

We have also tried to use the last modified date of job information, but as that is being overridden for any changes being done on the contingent worker record post the Nov 25th, we are not able to use the last modified date as well.

Requesting guidance on how we can report or identify backdated terminations for contingent workers based on the above scenario with the fields currently available in Report Centre.

entry.title: In People Stories - how do you extract the latest record
entry.content: I have users that attended classes and have multiple end dates for the same class id

entry.title: How to get Health and Safety information with API SuccessFactors ?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I am currently developing a solution that will read data from the SuccessFactors API, but I am stuck on the medical check section. Would anyone know how to retrieve this data via the API (the entity name and properties)? In the application, the data can be found under the "Additional Information" tab => Health and Safety => Medical check.

Thank you

entry.title: Please vote for Enhancement Request for AI for Comp Insights
entry.content:
Compensation Insights does not use data from the Pay Range object. As a result, any updates to the Pay Range after an employee‚Äôs last pay change will not be reflected in the compensation insights.

Example: An employee‚Äôs pay changes on 10-Jul-2025, resulting in a compa-ratio of 95%. On 01-Oct-2025, the Pay Range object is updated with a new salary range.  This new salary range changes their compa-ratio to 105%. This updated compa-ratio is not reflected when the manager generates Compensation Insights.

Please vote the enhancement request below to resolve this issue:

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/363380

entry.title: Possibility of Applying Multiple ESS Requests Simultaneously
entry.content:
Hi All,

While we are trying to apply for multiple employee self service at a time in SAP-Employee central, system is not allowing us to apply. Do we have any option to apply multiple ESS with same effective date

entry.title: Employee Central - Business Rule to default country in Home Address
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I would need some support or clarification on whether the following is even possible:
In SuccessFactors Employee Central, I would like to use a business rule on Home Address Information to default the country when a new record is created and make the field non-editable.

The background is that this should apply only to specific legal entities (e.g. certain company codes). The behavior should work both when the user maintains the data themselves and on the Hire screen.

Ideally, for the same legal entities and for existing records, I would also like the country field to be non-editable (view-only).

Is this technically possible? If not, could we discuss an alternative approach or workaround?

Thank you very much in advance.

Best regards,
Michael

entry.title: The position follow-up process failed because of an error in a prior global assignment process.
entry.content:
Hi,

When we create a Global Assignment for a user in the system, the ‚ÄúAway on Global Assignment‚Äù and ‚ÄúBack from Global Assignment‚Äù records are not automatically created in the Job Information of the Home Assignment.

Although the Right to Return configuration is active, the related records do not appear in the Home Assignment profile.

When we check the issue in Admin Alerts, we see the following error message: ‚ÄúThe position follow-up process failed because of an error in a prior global assignment process. Check your global assignment configuration. Then, retrigger the admin alert.‚Äù

What could be the reason for this error?
We would appreciate your support on this topic.

entry.title: How to Implement Data Synchronization Between SuccessFactors ECP and SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
‚óèIssue Description and Background
We would like to establish data integration and synchronization between our internal SuccessFactors ECP system and SAP S/4HANA Cloud for the following data objects:

1ÔºåInbound (S/4HANA ‚Üí ECP): Cost Center

2ÔºåInbound (S/4HANA ‚Üí ECP): Bank Master Data

3ÔºåInbound (S/4HANA ‚Üí ECP): Account Item Master Data

4ÔºåOutbound (EC / ECP ‚Üí S/4HANA): Customer Code (Vendor Employee Master Data)

5ÔºåOutbound (ECP ‚Üí S/4HANA): Salary, bonus, and retirement allowance journal entries

‚óèSystem Landscape / Environment

„ÉªSAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) / Employee Central Payroll (ECP)

„ÉªSAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Financial Accounting (FI)

‚óèActions Already Taken

1ÔºåBy following the guide ‚ÄúSetting up Core HR with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (JB1)‚Äù, we have completed the setup of Communication Systems and Communication Arrangements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

2ÔºåFor bank-related data, we understand that SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) is required. The CPI tenant has already been activated; however, we do not know how to configure the required iFlows.

3ÔºåWe have consulted various AI tools (including SAP Joule), but the answers provided were vague and not technically reliable.

‚óèExpected Outcome
„ÉªInbound: After creating bank master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the newly created bank information should be visible in ECP via transaction FI03

„ÉªOutbound: The method to verify outbound data synchronization is currently unclear; guidance would be appreciated

entry.title: How to notify Non-SuccessFactors User via mail about leave creation
entry.content:
Context:

We are using SAP SuccessFactors as the HR system for several legal entities in a consulting organization. Employees often work on global projects, and the respective project managers are not always SuccessFactors users, as not all legal entities within the group use SF as their HR system.

For each employee in SF, the project manager‚Äôs email address is available in SuccessFactors as a string field, being imported via interface from a global data source.

Business requirement:
When an employee creates a leave request (no approval required), the respective project manager should at least receive an email notification.

Constraints:

  • The project manager is not a SuccessFactors user

  • Project managers change frequently ‚Üí creating technical or dummy users is not feasible

  • SuccessFactors workflows and notifications cannot reference pure string email fields (at least based on my knowledge)

  • Approval by the project manager is not required, only an information email

Question:
Is there any standard or recommended way within SuccessFactors to trigger an email notification to a non-SF user's email address stored as a string field? Or is an external integration (e.g. Intelligent Services + middleware) the only viable approach?

Any best practices or real-life implementations would be highly appreciated.

Thanks a lot in advance!! 

SAP SuccessFactors Platform SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
